chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel M. Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. May not have contact with Todd L, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days & at least 30 days prior to the termination of the Defendant's probation.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Count 2 but consecutive to Case 22CF614.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel M. Rodriguez

records.addlTxt: Released as to this file only
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

4:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Angel M. Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Toni L. Young in court for Angel M. Rodriguez. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF371/22CF614. Victim rights compliance. Matter is resolved and agreement placed on the record.

22CF371: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 2-3; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 1 & 4 are dismissed and read in. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions - consecutive to Case 22CF614. No contact with Todd L.. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered. No restitution requested.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant.

22CF614: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 2 is dismissed and read in. PSI waived and sentencing arguments heard. Court imposes total sentence  5 years WSP; 2 years IC w/credit for 201 days served, 3 years extended supervision w/ conditions; No contact with Todd L.. Defendant is not eligible for SAP/CIP. Court costs ordered. Defendant to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Certified copy of minutes given to KSD deputy.
Elements of charges for which defendant is pleading guilty filed by Defense Counsel T. Young

08:58 AM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Angel M. Rodriguez, appeared in custody with Attorney Toni L. Young.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF371/22CF614. Bond motion filed in Case 22CF614 by Attorney Young. Arugments heard; The State objects. For reasons set forth on the record Court will deny the bond motion. Attorney Young is requesting an adjournment. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of assignment of judge returned. Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed.Unable to forward.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Angel M. Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waive time to allow SPD to appoint.  DE wants to proceed pro se.     ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; no cross by DE. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered by the Court. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:55 PM  
  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody but no appearnace - refusing to appear.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on 5/11/22 @ 830am. before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  Bond is continued.    jk

Defendant Angel M. Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Court is unsure if DE is eligible for SPD.    DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Deft is eligible for SPD services, however, no atty has agreed to represent this applicant.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: David H, Joseph C, Plaza Hotel 5711 7th Ave, Leonard B, KPD Officer Z Berry except for incidental in professional capacity. The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.
